body.p:
New Castle septr 9t 1865
To the Governor of Ky.

The Petitioner Abrahm Rucker States that in or about March 1864 he had a difficulty with his Cousin James Rucker growing out of a play & scuffle. They both got mad. James Rucker drew a knife threatng to Kill the Petitioner He rushed on petitioner taking by the throat and fearg for his life he drew a pistol & fired wounding slghty his cousins Ear. They were also both excited with Liquor --

These are the facts as proved before the Jury which tried the case at the late septr term of the Hny circuit Court upon indictment for a misdemeanor And the Jury fined petitioner $50 -- It was also proved which is the fact that he & his cousin ever since the difficulty have as before been warm friends He states that he is sorry the difficulty hapened and asks that your Honor will remit the fine. That he is poor and unable to pay it.

The undersigned James Rucker states that the above statements made by his Cousin Abraham Rucker are true That he was not hurt by the Shot save a slight wound in his Ear. He
respectfully asks that the fine may be remitted --
The undersigned being fully advised of the facts in this case Respctfully ask and petition Goven Bramlett to remit the fine against Abrm Rucker of fifty Dollars --

C M Matthews
W. J. Brewer sheriff H. C.
